questions.question: From which embryonic structure is the spinal cord derived?

Mr. Marquez, a 68-year-old retired comedian, presented to the neurology clinic complaining of difficulty speaking after a sudden onset of weakness on his right side. He was recently found slumped over his workbench after he had a stroke.  On examination, he is alert and oriented but has difficulty producing speech. He can only manage a few words at a time, like ""dog... walk... here."" His comprehension is good; he understands simple questions and can follow simple commands. What type of aphasia is most likely seen in this patient?
Which of the following correctly shows the flow of cerebrospinal fluid?

answers.text: Fourth ventricle → Foramen of Magendie and Luschka → Lateral Ventricles → Interventricular foramen or Foramen of Monroe
Interventricular foramen of Monroe → Third Ventricle → Foramen of Magendie → Fourth Ventricle → Lateral Ventricles → Foramen of Luschka
Third Ventricle → Lateral Ventricles → Interventricular foramen of Monroe → Fourth Ventricle → Foramen of Magendie → Foramen of Luschka
Lateral ventricles → Interventricular foramen or Foramen of Monroe → Third ventricle → Aqueduct of Sylvius → Fourth ventricle → Foramen of Magendie and Luschka

questions.question: Gerstmann syndrome affects what lobe of the brain?
What muscle of mastication opens the mouth?
What extraocular muscle moves the eye upward and medially?
Which is the only extrinsic tongue muscle innervated by cranial nerve X?
What branch of the facial nerve is responsible for relaying taste sensation from the anterior two-third of the tongue and floor of the mouth?

A 48-year-old male presents to the emergency department with a sudden, severe headache that he describes as the worst he's ever felt. He also reports nausea, vomiting, and neck stiffness. His initial CT scan reveals a hyperattenuation around the  circle of Willis. What type of intracranial hemorrhage is most likely seen in this patient?
The facial artery and vein pass through what triangle of the neck?
Which of the following results from bilateral injury to the recurrent laryngeal nerve?

answers.text: Loss of tension of sensation above the vocal cords
Loss of tension of vocal cords

questions.question: A 19-year-old male presented to the emergency department with chest pain and shortness of breath following blunt trauma to the chest during a hazing event. A chest X-ray performed in the ER revealed an elevated right hemidiaphragm. What provides the sole motor supply to the diaphragm?
Which of the following statements is false about the sternal angle of Louis?

answers.text: It is a horizontal plane intersecting Sternal angle and disk between T3 and T4 vertebrae
Site where the trachea bifurcates into right and left primary bronchi
Arch of the Aorta arises from the Ascending Aorta and continues as the Descending Aorta
Pulmonary trunk divides into right and left pulmonary artery

questions.question: A 19-year-old cheerleader fell down after losing balance while doing a one-leg stunt. A chest X ray revealed a fractured left third rib. Which of the following structure is not attached to the third rib?

answers.text: Transverse process of the third vertebra

questions.question: A 57-year-old male passerby was stabbed on his left side with an icepick by a snatcher. He developed tension pneumothorax. The ER physician on duty performed a needle decompression on his left chest. What is the correct arrangement of neurovasculature on the inferior margin of the ribs?

A 58-year-old man came to the emergency department with chest pain, and his angiogram exhibited that he has an infarct in the artery accompanied by the great cardiac vein. Which of the following arteries is most likely involved?
A 45-year-old male was diagnosed with a posterior mediastinal mass. Which of the following structures is found in the posterior mediastinum?
All of the following muscles are involved in expiration except:
Which of the following structures mainly form the diaphragmatic surface of the heart?
Which of the following structures form the right border of the heart?
Where is the cardiac plexus located?
The sinoatrial (SA) node is the main pacemaker of the heart. Where is the SA node located?

answers.text: interatrial septum superior to the opening of coronary sinus
Right atrium near the superior vena cava
membranous portion of the IV septum

questions.question: A 42-year-old male, hypertensive, and poorly compliant to his medications presents to the Emergency Room with chest pain. Coronary angiogram revealed blockage to the right coronary artery. Which of the following conditions will result from the blockage of the said artery?

answers.text: Necrosis of the myocardium of the anterior interventricular septum
Ischemia to the apex of the heart

questions.question: A 65-year-old male presents to the emergency room with chest pain that is not relieved by rest and radiates to the medial aspect of the left arm. A 12-lead ECG was performed and revealed an ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI). Which nerve is responsible for the pain radiating to the said extremity?
Which of the following is not a component of the Tetralogy of Fallot?
Which of the following is a cup-like dome over the apex that reaches 2-3cm superior to the level of the medial 1/3 of the clavicle?
The lingula is found in which lobe of the lung?

answers.text: Superior lobe of the left lung
Inferior lobe of the left lung
Middle lobe of the right lung
Inferior lobe of the right lung

questions.question: Patient AA, a 5-year-old child, a was brought to the ED after aspirating a gummy bear upon eating while lying supine.  At which bronchopulmonary segment is the foreign body most likely found?

answers.text: Posterior basal BPS of the right lower lobe
Superior BPS of the right lower lobe
Posterior BPS of the right upper lobe
Inferior lingular BPS of the left upper lobe

questions.question: Which of the following structures do not pass through the esophageal opening?
The first heart sound is produced by near-simultaneous closure of which of the following valves?
The SA node receives its blood supply from the right coronary artery. The right coronary artery is a branch of which of the following blood vessel?
The first left posterior intercostal vein drains to which of the following structures?
Which of the following correctly describes the brachiocephalic vein?

answers.text: It is formed by the union of the external jugular vein and internal jugular vein
It is formed by the union of the internal jugular vein and the subclavian vein
It is a continuation of the sigmoid sinus
The right and left brachiocephalic veins unite to form the inferior vena cava

questions.question: A 40-year-old female patient came to the clinic for a 3-year history of gradually enlarging right breast mass. Upon physical examination, the skin surrounding the areola appears dimpled, pitted, and thickened, resembling the rind of an orange. What is the mechanism of this physical examination finding?

answers.text: Lymph blockage due to microemboli of cancer cells resulting to lymphedema of the breast
Injury to the long thoracic nerve

questions.question: A 57-year-old female patient underwent radical mastectomy of her left breast for a Stage II Breast Adenocarcinoma. Several weeks after the said operation, the patient had difficulty in adduction, extension, and rotation of her left upper extremity medially. What nerve is most likely injured in the aforementioned surgical procedure?

A 35-year-old female presented in the clinic with a right breast mass on the upper quadrant. Upon physical examination, the clinical clerk noted two enlarged lymph nodes approximately medial to the pectoralis minor muscle. What group of nodes is most likely involved in this patient?
Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding the lung bronchi?

answers.text: The right main bronchus is wider, shorter and more vertical
The right lung contains three secondary bronchi: one eparterial and two hyparterial bronchi
The left main bronchus is longer, narrower, and descends inferolaterally
The arch of the azygos vein is found in the left lung

questions.question: A 17-year-old male presented with right lower quadrant abdominal pain, accompanied by fever, nausea, and vomiting. He was diagnosed with acute appendicitis, and an emergency appendectomy was performed. During the procedure, the surgeon made an abdominal incision and exposed Camper’s fascia. At the level of the scrotum, Camper’s fascia develops into which structure?

The inferior epigastric artery provides collateral circulation to the anterior abdominal way via an anastomosis with the superior epigastric artery. This inferior epigastric artery is a branch of which of the following structures?
Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding the nerve supply and lymphatic drainage of the anterior abdominal wall?

answers.text: The ilioinguinal nerve pierces the external oblique aponeurosis above superficial inguinal ring
The ilioinguinal nerve emerges through the superficial inguinal ring
The region above the umbilicus drains into the axillary lymph nodes
The region below the umbilicus drains into the deep inguinal lymph nodes

questions.question: What forms the posterior rectus sheath above the arcuate line?

answers.text: External oblique and internal oblique aponeuroses
Transversus abdominis and internal oblique aponeuroses
External oblique, internal oblique, and transversus abdominis aponeuroses
There is no posterior layer of the rectus sheath above the arcuate line

questions.question: A 15-year-old male patient from Mandaue City presents with a 4 cm × 4 cm reducible mass in his right inguinal region. The mass becomes most noticeable when he strains during physical activity or heavy lifting. An indirect inguinal hernia is suspected. Relative to the Hesselbach triangle, in which area is this type of hernia typically seen?

answers.text: Medial to the inferior epigastric vessels
Lateral to the inferior epigastric vessels
Within the borders of the Hesselbach’s triangle
Medial to the rectus abdominis muscle

questions.question: A clinical clerk elicits the cremasteric reflex by stroking the skin of the superior and medial thigh. A noticeable elevation of the testis is observed due to the contraction of the cremaster muscle. The motor fibers responsible for this response come from which nerve?
Which of the following ligaments is described as the folded lower border of the aponeurosis of the external oblique muscle?
All of the following are retroperitoneal organs except?
At which vertebral level is the superior mesenteric artery found?
Which of the following marks the first esophageal constriction?

answers.text: Aortic arch and left main bronchus

questions.question: A 55-year-old male with a history of chronic gastroesophageal reflux disease, presenting with heartburn, regurgitation, and occasional dysphagia, underwent upper endoscopy. Biopsy revealed that the lining of the distal third of the esophagus had been replaced by intestinal-type cells. The blood supply to the lower third of the esophagus is provided by which vessel?
Which part of the duodenum is held in position by the Ligament of Treitz?
The fundus of the stomach is the dilated superior part related to the left dome of the diaphragm. Which of the following provides the blood supply to the fundus?
The median umbilical ligament is the adult derivative of which fetal structure?

A 2-year-old child presents to the emergency department with a history of sudden, intermittent abdominal pain, vomiting, and what appears to be ""currant jelly"" stool as observed by the parents. Physical examination revealed a palpable right upper quadrant mass. What is the most likely diagnosis of this patient?
Which of the following statements is true regarding the small intestines?

answers.text: The jejunum occupies the false pelvis in the RLQ.
The ileum has longer vasa recta with fewer arcades.
The Peyer’s patches are found in the jejunum.
The ileum forms the distal 3/5th of the small intestine.

questions.question: The middle third of the rectum is supplied by the middle rectal artery which is a branch of which of the vessel?
What is the largest branch of the lumbar plexus?
Which of the following structures are not enclosed by Gerota’s fascia?
Glucocorticoids are produced in which part of the adrenal gland?
Which of the following ureteric constriction is considered as the true physical constriction and is described as the narrowest portion of the ureter?

answers.text: Where the renal pelvis joins the ureter
Crossing the pelvic brim and external iliac artery

questions.question: A 42-year-old male, Mr. Batongbakal, presents to the emergency room with a history of severe, colicky pain in his left flank, radiating down to his groin. He reports nausea and vomiting, but denies fever or chills.  A CT stonogram was performed which revealed a 10 mm kidney stone at the pelvic segment of the left ureter. What artery supplies the affected area?
How many lobes does the prostate have?
How is the midplane of the pelvis measured?
Which of the following structures passes through the lesser sciatic foramen?
All of the following structures converge at the perineal body except?
Which of the following is not part of the levator ani?
What female structure is homologous to the prostate gland in males?

A 27-year-old female, G1P0, presents to the emergency department with severe, right lower abdominal pain, amenorrhea for 6 weeks, and a history of spotting.  A positive pregnancy test is confirmed. Ultrasound reveals an empty uterus and a mass in the left adnexa, highly suggestive of a ectopic pregnancy. Which part of the fallopian tube is the most common site of ectopic pregnancy?

Mrs. Epektibo, a 58-year-old woman, underwent radical hysterectomy with bilateral oophorectomy for adenomyosis for definitive treatment. The surgeon notes the uterine artery ascending laterally along the broad ligament. Which blood vessel does the uterine artery anastomose with?
The labia minora drain to which of the following lymph nodes?
The ovarian artery and vein are found within which attachment of the ovaries?
Which of the following is not a branch of the posterior division of the internal iliac artery?

A 26-year-old G2P1(1001) patient is administered with local anesthetic transvaginally to block the pudendal nerve. What anatomic landmark guides the administration of the local anesthetic via this approach?
In oogenesis, meiosis II is completed with the extrusion of a mature oocyte and the second polar body during what event?
In majority of women, what is the most common position of the uterus?
Which of the following is described as a dense fibrous layer that envelops both the corpora cavernosa and corpus spongiosum?
Which of the following is a described as the fetal, retroperitoneal mesenchymal cord that extends between the caudal pole of the fetal testis and scrotum and guides the testis in its descent?

A 65-year-old male presents with a history of increasing urinary frequency and urgency, nocturia, and weak stream along with a family history of prostate cancer in his paternal side. He has also reported a recent onset of back pain. Initial PSA levels are elevated. Digital rectal exam was performed. What zone of the prostate gland is most commonly involved in carcinomas?
The ejaculatory duct is formed by the union of which structures from the male reproductive system?

A 72-year-old woman presents with pain and swelling of her right wrist after falling onto the back of her hand. Radiologic findings of the affected limb reveal anterior displacement of the distal fragment. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following structures traverse the quadrangular space?
The knee joint is composed by which of the following structures?
All of the following are structures contained in the popliteal fossa except?

A 69-year-old make underwent coronary artery bypass grafting after a significant three-vessel occlusion was seen in his coronary angiogram. The surgical team harvested the great saphenous vein as a conduit for bypassing the obstructed coronary arteries. What is the anatomic landmark to locate the great saphenous vein?

answers.text: Between the tendons of the extensor hallucis longus and the extensor digitorum longus

questions.question: Which of the following muscles is considered as the main flexor of the forearm?
Which of the following structures forms the medial boundary of the anatomic snuffbox?
Which of the following is the only flexor of the forearm innervated by the radial nerve?
What forms the lateral boundary of the cubital fossa?

Mr. Rose, a 31-year-old professional basketball player, presents to the sports medicine clinic with acute left knee pain and swelling. The injury occurred the previous evening during a game when he jumped to block a shot and landed awkwardly with his knee twisted inward. Injury involving the unhappy triad is highly suspected. Which of the following structures is not included in the said triad?
Which of the following structures is described as the prolongation of the pia mater from the tip (conus medullaris) of the spinal cord at the level of L2?
How many pairs of spinal nerves are present in the human body?
The alveoli of the lungs are lined with which type of epithelium?
Which of the following cells are responsible for myelin production in the CNS?
Which type of muscle is a branching, striated muscle with one central nucleus?
What connective tissue surrounds the muscle fibers?
What structure serves as the site of sperm maturation?
Type I collagen is found in which of the following structures?
All of the following contains a serosa except:
All of the following contain elastic cartilage except:
The intrinsic factor is produced in what cell of the stomach?
Centroacinar cells are characteristically found in what organ?
What supplies the choroid plexus of the lateral ventricles, optic tract and radiations, and the lateral geniculate body?
Which part of the renal tubule contains the brush border?
A patient is examined to have right nasal hemianopia. Where is the most probable site of the lesion?

answers.text: Uncrossed fibers on the right optic chiasm

questions.question: Pancreatic divisum arises from _______?

answers.text: Failure of ventral and dorsal bud to fuse
Failure of ventral and dorsal bud to divide
Failure of the ventral bud to rotate

questions.question: Bronchopulmonary segments that are found in the superior lobe of right lung:

answers.text: Apical, Posterior, Anterior, Superior lingular, Inferior lingular
Superior, Medial basal, Anterior basal, Lateral basal, Posterior basal

questions.question: A dilated azygous vein most likely will compress what structure?
A 27-year-old cardiac patient with an irregular heartbeat visits her doctor’s office for examination. Where should the physician place the stethoscope to listen to the sound of the mitral valve?

answers.text: Over the medial end of the second left intercostal space
Over the medial end of the second right intercostal space
In the left lower sternal border
In the left fifth intercostal space at the midclavicular line

questions.question: What supplies the right and left ventricles, and the inferior ⅓ of the interventricular septum?
Most common direction of femoral dislocation:
What nerve roots are most commonly affected in hip dislocation?
What is the most common lobe to be affected in atelectasis?
Which of the following is INCORRECT regarding bartholin’s glands?

answers.text: Lie in the deep perineal space deep to the vestibular bulbs in the female
Are homologous to the bulbourethral glands in the male
Are compressed during coitus and secrete mucus that lubricates the vagina
Ducts open into the vestibule between the labium minora below the hymen

questions.question: The adrenal medulla originates from which of the following?
What level of the duodenum is found at L3?
The sacral plexus is formed by the anterior rami of which nerves?
Where does the subscapularis insert?
Lymphatic drainage of scrotum:
What protects against pelvic prolapse?
A forensic pathologist is examining the pelvic bone of a murder victim to identify the sex of the victim. Which of the following characteristics is that of a female pelvis?
During a game, a 26-year-old baseball player is hit in the head by a baseball, which fractures the optic canal. Which of the following pairs of structures is most likely to be damaged?
What is the male counterpart of Gartner's duct cyst?
Approximately at what age does the testes enter the scrotum?
In a renal transplant, what vessels are anastomosed?

answers.text: Renal artery and internal iliac artery
Renal vein to internal iliac vein
Renal vein to inferior vena cava

questions.question: A 16-year-old boy presents with double vision. Further examination reveals that he has difficulty in turning his eye inferolaterally and trouble going downstairs. Which of the following nerves is most likely damaged?
What bone/bones is/are responsible for the transverse arch of the foot?
What is the efferent nucleus of the pupillary reflex?
A 59-year-old stroke patient is unable to swallow because of a nerve injury. Which of the following nerves is unaffected?
Lambert Eaton myasthenic syndrome is characterized by the following EXCEPT:

answers.text: Presents with symptoms of symmetrical proximal muscle weakness
Majority of cases are associated with small cell lung cancer
About half of all patients experience either fluctuating ptosis or binocular diplopia as the first symptoms

questions.question: What is the most superior structure in the hilum of the left lung?

A 42-year-old obese woman with seven children is brought to a local hospital by her daughter. Physical examination and her radiograph reveal that large gallstones have ulcerated through the posterior wall of the fundus of the gallbladder into the intestine. Which of the following parts of the intestine is most likely to initially contain gallstones?

A radiograph of a 32-year-old woman reveals a perforation in the posterior wall of the stomach in which the gastric contents have spilled into the lesser sac. The general surgeon has opened the gastrosplenic ligament to reach the lesser sac and notes the ulcer eroded into an artery. Which artery is most likely involved?
Which of the following contain slit-like processes that filter blood?
In the oocyte cycle, metaphase II is complete when what happens?
What forms the medial boundary of the antecubital fossa?
Which of the following is the largest & most mobile part of the large intestine?
What is the second messenger of ACTH?
Which of the following will you NOT transect if you pierce at the anterior axillary line for a thoracostomy?
A patient has difficulty when walking uphill, climbing stairs, or rising from a sitting position. Which of the following nerves is most likely affected?
Which of the following is TRUE about the scrotum?

answers.text: It is supplied by testicular artery
It is innervated by the genitofemoral and ilioinguinal nerve
It is drained by the deep inguinal lymph nodes
The scrotal veins drain primarily to the internal pudendal veins

questions.question: All of the following present with crescentic histology EXCEPT:
What is the action of superior oblique muscle?
Which gland undergoes involution as humans grow older?

A 55 y/o heavy alcoholic drinker male experienced bouts of vomiting of previously ingested food after binging on alcohol during a family reunion.  He became alarmed when he suddenly started vomiting blood. What is the most likely diagnosis?
The emissary veins are found between which of the following?

answers.text: The dural and the arachnoid mater
The pia mater and the brain

questions.question: Where does the neural tube start to close?
True about the conducting system:

answers.text: SA node is the pacemaker of the heart located at the lower end of the crista terminalis
AV node is supplied by the left coronary artery
SA Node is supplied by the right coronary artery
AV node lies in the septal wall of the left atrium, superior and medial to the opening of the coronary sinus

questions.question: Cardiac tamponade occurs when fluid accumulation in the finite serous pericardial space causes an increase in pressure, with subsequent cardiac compression and hemodynamic compromise. Cardiac tamponade is most commonly found in which type of pericarditis?

An intern is attempting to insert a foley catheter in a male patient. When he inserts approximately 11-12 cm of the catheter in, he notices resistance. Which part of the male urethra has the foley catheter most likely  reached?
The optic nerve passes through the optic canal together with which structure?
When doing lacrimal duct surgery, how far should a surgeon incise in order to avoid the blood vessels?
All of the following describes a Pancoast Tumor, EXCEPT

answers.text: Produces pain on the upper extremity
Causes atrophy of the forearm muscles

questions.question: During development, the midgut artery appears to be markedly narrowed at its origin. Which structure is derived from the midgut and may receive inadequate blood supply?
Mr. Cruz was diagnosed to have ureteric stones. The possible areas where these stones can be lodged are in any of the following, EXCEPT:
Mr. Salvador underwent a KUB-IVP and it revealed a dilated left ureter from the renal pelvis up to the level of L4. You would suspect that a ureterolith might probably be lodged in the ____.
During a thyroidectomy, the surgeon notices profuse bleeding on the thyroid isthmus after midline incision. Which of the following arteries is the most likely source of bleeding?
Which cell has a “ground-glass” cytoplasmic appearance?

A 53 year old man was admitted to hospital complaining of chronic gastric ulcer unresponsive to medical treatment. The surgeon decided to perform a vagotomy. The anterior vagal trunk was divided between sutures as it lies on the anterior surface of the abdominal part of the esophagus. Which of the following is likely to result from this procedure?

answers.text: Loss of secretomotor supply to the mucosal glands of the stomach.
Hoarse voice because of paralysis of intrinsic muscles of the larynx on the left side
Increased heart rate because of decreased parasympathetic input to the cardiac
Incontinence because of an absence of parasympathetic input to the bladder

questions.question: The hypothenar eminence is formed by the following muscles, EXCEPT
Which of the following muscles of the head moves the scalp on the skull and raise the eyebrows?
The curvature of the vertebral column that appears when the child begins to stand and walk is the:
A muscle of the medial compartment of the thigh that can flex the knee joint
Removal of the duodenum necessitates removal of this organ
Which statement is TRUE of the common bile duct?

answers.text: It is a tube-like structure passing down from the neck of the gallbladder
It is formed near the porta hepatis by the junction of the cystic and common hepatic ducts
It projects obliquely appearing like a spiral valve and is embedded in the liver parenchyma
The sphincter of Oddi serves as a valve at the junction of the cystic and hepatic ducts

questions.question: Which of the ff is the peritoneal reflection from the body wall to the intestines?
The respiratory diaphragm is inserted into the:
Stones in the renal pelvis when dislodged will most likely be lodged in these parts of the ureter, EXCEPT:

answers.text: As it is crossed by the ductus deferens
As it crosses the pelvic brim

questions.question: Venous sinuses of the brain are found between which of the following?

answers.text: Inner meningeal and outer endosteal layer of dura mater

questions.question: During insertion of a catheter, one has to bear in mind that the least distensible portion of the male urethra is the:
Which of the following serves as the main filter of the glomerulus?
Fluorescence of semen under ultraviolet light is due to secretions from which of the following glands:
Body temperature is regulated in what part of the CNS:
Decussation of the corticospinal tract occurs in which segment of the CNS:
A 27-year-old cardiac patient with an irregular heartbeat visits her doctor’s office for examination. Where should the physician place the stethoscope to listen to the sound of the mitral valve?

answers.text: Over the medial end of the second left intercostal space
Over the medial end of the second right intercostal space
In the left fourth intercostal space at the midclavicular line
In the left fifth intercostal space at the midclavicular line

questions.question: A 37-year-old patient with palpitation was examined by her physician, and one of the diagnostic records included a posterior–anterior chest radiograph. Which of the following comprises the largest portion of the sternocostal surface of the heart seen on the radiograph?

A thoracentesis is performed to aspirate an abnormal accumulation of fluid in a 37-year old patient with pleural effusion. A needle should be inserted at the midaxillary line between which of the following two ribs so as to avoid puncturing the lung?

A neonate appears severely cyanotic and breathing rapidly. Cardiac echocardiogram reveals that the aorta lies to the right of the pulmonary trunk. Which of the following most likely occurred during development?

answers.text: AP septum failed to develop in a spiral fashion

questions.question: A 62-year-old patient with pericardial effusion comes to a local hospital for aspiration of pericardial fluid by pericardiocentesis. The needle is inserted into the pericardial cavity through which of the following intercostal spaces adjacent to the sternum?
A 47-year-old man with a known atrial fibrillation returns to see his cardiologist for follow-up of his cardiac health. The right atrium is important in this case because it:

answers.text: Receives blood from the oblique cardiac vein
Is associated with the apex of the heart

questions.question: A 42-year-old obese woman with seven children is brought to a local hospital by her daughter. Physical examination and her radiograph reveal that large gallstones have ulcerated through the posterior wall of the fundus of the gallbladder into the intestine. Which of the following parts of the intestine is most likely to initially contain gallstones?
Mrs. Jones is undergoing a routine colonoscopy for colon cancer prevention. The gastroenterologist finds a Meckel diverticulum. Which of the following statements is true about the diverticulum?

answers.text: It is found 2 ft distal to the ileocecal junction
It is located on the mesenteric side of the ileum
It occurs in approximately 20% of the population
It is a persistent remnant of the embryonic yolk stalk

questions.question: A 22-year-old man has a gonorrheal infection that has infiltrated the space between the inferior fascia of the urogenital diaphragm and the superficial perineal fascia. Which of the following structures might be inflamed?

answers.text: Membranous part of the male urethra

questions.question: A first-year resident in the urology department reviews pelvic anatomy before seeing patients. Which of the following statements is correct?

answers.text: The dorsal artery of the penis supplies the glans penis
The duct of the bulbourethral gland opens into the membranous urethra
The duct of the greater vestibular gland opens into the vagina

questions.question: A 57-year-old man comes to the local hospital with fever, headache, nausea, and vomiting. Laboratory tests reveal an infection, and radiologic examination localizes the infection to the cavernous sinus. Which of the following nerves would be unaffected by this condition?

answers.text: Mandibular division of the trigeminal nerve

questions.question: A 53-year-old artist with known kidney disease presents to a hospital because her pain has become increasingly more severe. The surgeon performing the kidney operation must remember that:

answers.text: The left kidney lies a bit lower than the right one
The perirenal fat lies external to the renal fascia
The renal fascia does not surround the suprarenal gland
The left renal vein runs anterior to both the aorta and the left renal artery

questions.question: A neonatal baby was born with diabetes mellitus due to an inadequate production of insulin. Cells in the endocrine portion of the pancreas that secrete insulin, glucagon, and somatostatin are derived from which of the following?
What is the smooth muscle that forms the floor of the bladder?
Which of the following is a function of ankyrin in red blood cells?

answers.text: Forms tetramers and provides a scaffold for structural reinforcement
Attaches to binding sites on the spectrin tetramers and holds them together
Binds to and stabilizes spectrin–actin complexes
Attaches the spectrin–actin complex to transmembrane proteins

questions.question: Poikilocytes may be found in the following condition/s:
The functional deficiency in DiGeorge syndrome primarily affects:

answers.text: Both T Cells and B Cells

questions.question: The angle between manubrium and sternum lies at the level of what structure?

answers.text: Superior border of the superior mediastinum

questions.question: A 67-year-old woman comes to her physician complaining of visual loss. Her MRI scan shows an enlarged pituitary gland that lies in the sella turcica, immediately posterior and superior to which of the following structures?

A 24-year-old woman presents with an asymptomatic fluid-filled cyst on the midline of the neck. She is diagnosed with a thyroglossal duct cyst. Which organ migrates through the thyroglossal duct during embryologic development?
Which nerve is most likely affected in a medial epicondyle fracture?
Test to examine for scoliosis by having the patient bend forward with knees straight and head hanging straight down between extended arms:
Which nerve roots are affected in Klumpke Palsy?
Which of the following muscles is inserted in the lesser tuberosity of the humerus?
Which part of the kidney is devoid of Gerota’s fascia?

A neonate has a small reducible protrusion through a defined ring at the umbilicus. His pediatrician advises the parents that this will likely close spontaneously. Which of the following congenital malformations is present?
Which of the following conditions causes subfalcine herniation with increased CSF?
Which of the following statements about neuroglial cells is INCORRECT?

answers.text: There are no neuroglial cells in the CNS
Schwann cells are present only in the PNS
Microglia are located in both gray and white matter of the CNS
Ependymal cells promote movement of CSF DISCUSSION

questions.question: The following structures pass through the optic canal EXCEPT
What cranial nerve innervates the efferent limb of the pupillary reflex
